{"step_by_step_thinking": "Coarctation of the aorta (A) is a congenital heart defect that can be managed with surgery or catheter procedures, and while it can pose risks during pregnancy, it is not typically associated with the highest maternal mortality. AS (C) and MS (D) refer to aortic stenosis and mitral stenosis, respectively, which are valvular heart diseases that can also pose risks during pregnancy, but again, are not typically associated with the highest maternal mortality. Eisenmenger syndrome (B), on the other hand, is a severe form of pulmonary hypertension that can develop in people with certain congenital heart defects. Pregnancy in women with Eisenmenger syndrome is associated with a very high risk of complications, including death, and is generally advised against.", "answer_choice": "B"}
